data.event: Jesse Kilts homesteaded in the area, and when a post office was established on September 15, 1914, it was named for Mr. Kilts, whose wife, Ruth, was the first postmaster.
Kilts post office closed on June 29, 1940.

event.title: 1993 only one of the private homes in which the post office was located

data.event: According to author Ralph Friedman, as of 1993 only one of the private homes in which the post office was located was still standing, all the rest having been burned or torn down.
